context: As the terrain is generally arid, the hills have mostly poor soil and support only cacti and <a0_0>succulent<a0_0/> plants. During the rainy season the area turns green with vegetation and grass. <a1_0>The eastern part<a1_0/> of the island is greener as it receives more rainfall. A <b5_0>1994<b5_0/> survey has revealed <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>several hundred<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> indigenous species of plants including the naturalized varieties of flora; some growing in irrigated areas while the dry areas are dominated by the cacti variety. <a3_0><b8_0>Sea grapes<b8_0/><a3_0/> and palm trees are a common sight with mangroves and shrubs surviving in the saline coastal swamps.
